Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment5.Shape
      • assignment5.Line
  • public class Line
extends Shape
    Version:
    1.0.0 Public class for Line Objects. Extends the abstract class Shape.
    Author:
    Nick Thompson

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line​(int startX,
            int startY,
            int endX,
            int endY)
        Class constructor that creates a Line object. Accepts startX, startY, endX, endY as parameters. Assigns the Line object a random color.
        Parameters:
        startX - The x-coordinate of the starting point of the Line.
        startY - The y-coordinate of the starting point of the Line.
        endX - The x-coordinate of the ending point of the Line.
        endY - The y-coordinate of the ending point of the Line.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Implements Shape's abstract draw method. Sets the color of the Graphics object to be the color of the Line. Calls the drawLine(int, int, int, int) method of the Graphics object.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Shape
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object.

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(int x,
                        int y)
        Implements Shape's abstract contains method. Uses the starting and ending points of the Line object to determine if the test point is within 0.5 units of the Line object.
        Specified by:
        contains in class Shape
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the test point.
        y - The y-coordinate of the test point.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • distanceOf

        public double distanceOf​(int x1,
                         int y1,
                         int x2,
                         int y2)
        Uses the distance formula to return the distance between two points.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x-coordinate of the first point.
        y1 - The y-coordinate of the first point.
        x2 - The x-coordinate of the second point.
        y2 - The y-coordinate of the second point.
        Returns:
        The calculated distance
